Quotes and pull-text MUST use Cormorant Garamond (Italic).
Navigation links should be uppercase and tracking-widest.

general_rules: NEVER use standard Bootstrap/Material layouts. Think 'Poster Design' for every section.
Use 'Playfair Display' for all headings (h1-h3). Use 'DM Sans' for body text.
Implement a 'Noise' overlay on the body background to give a paper texture feel.
Buttons should be sharp (rounded-none) and uppercase.
Use generous padding (py-24, py-32) between sections.
Images should often overlap text or other images (z-index layering).
Use 1px solid borders for separation instead of shadows.
For the Reader view, focus on typography legibility: max-width-prose, comfortable leading.

landing_page.hero: Split screen or full-width image with massive overlay typography. The ISBN input should be the centerpiece, styled like a luxury search bar.
landing_page.features: Use a 'Bento' grid or alternating magazine layout (Text Left/Image Right -> Image Left/Text Right).

reader_view.layout: Distraction-free. Cream/Paper background. Serif font for the book text. Progress bar should be thin and elegant (like a bookmark).
reader_view.controls: Minimalist, floating or tucked away in a drawer.

dashboard.style: Grid of book covers. Use a masonry layout if possible. Stats should be displayed with large numbers and small labels (Editorial style).

accessibility.contrast: Ensure text is #121212 on #F2F0E9 background for maximum readability.
accessibility.focus_states: Use a sharp 2px solid border (#D93025) for focus states.

do_not: Do NOT use gradients for backgrounds (except subtle noise).
Do NOT use generic 'blue' for links. Use black or red.
Do NOT center text unless it's a specific 'Editor's Note' style section.
must_do: MUST use the provided image URLs for placeholders.
MUST add data-testid to all interactive elements.
